I made a mistake in my previous posting. Unfortunately, until now my
post w=
asn't posted, so I have no source to quote. I have waited a
while, but it i=
s very late know so I want go to sleep. Approximate
quote is "We should def=
ine helper class because YourTest class must
have only one construtor." It =
is obviously wrong. You can define
static method (a function) and call it f=
rom their. If you want to be
able to overload these functions you can defin=
e them as (instance)
methods and in @Parametrized function instantiate Your=
Test using the
only constructor with "garbage" parameters. Note, that @Para=
metrized
function is static, so you can't call instance method directly, yo=
u
have to instantiate instance of this class. In your subclass you
should j=
ust instantiate your subclass instead and mechanism of
inheritance will wor=
k.

It is clearly design decision, whether to use helper class or not. You
=
can avoid this whether by using (static) function or by using
"garbage" as =
parameters to your constructor. While using a helper
class is much "cleaner=
" disadvantage of this approach is creation a
helper class.
